data.title: Crafts by Channin
data.text:
Hello all!! The Spring 2024 Catalog release is now available!!! This release is jam-packed with so so many absolutely incredible stamps, stencils, dies, letterpress + foil plates and transfers!! I have a TON of cards to share so let’s dive in!!

My first card features the Decorative Strips Stamp Set. This set coordinates with the previously release Sentiment Strips Fancy Die.

To create this card I first stamped and white heat-embossed the Decorative Strips stamp onto 5 different A2 panels of colored cardstock (Ultra Pink, Amethyst, Paradise, Kiwi, Pumpkin). I then die cut the panels with the Sentiment Strips Fancy Die.

Next, I adhered the strips to the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. I then die cut “friend” out of Pitch Black cardstock with one of the dies from the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL. Next, I stamped and white heat-embossed a sub-sentiment from the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL onto Pitch Black cardstock.

I then trimmed the sentiment down to a strip and adhered the strip and “friend” to the card front with foam adhesive. Lastly, I die cut a couple of butterflies with the new Butterfly Foliage Fancy Dies out of Dove White cardstock and adhered to the card front with Precision Glue.

My next card features the one of the new Letterpress + Foil Plates, the Happy Birthday Letterpress + Foil Plate. That’s right you can hot foil as well as letterpress with these new plates!!! Unfortunately all the new Letterpress + Foil Plates have been delayed and won’t be available till the end of February.

To create this card I first taped off the front of an A2 top-folding Dove White card base and then ink blended with Key Lime Fizz, Blue Raspberry, Thistle and Taffy Reactive Ink.

Next, I hot foiled the Happy Birthday Letterpress + Foil Plate over card front with matte gold foil. I then die cut an A2 panel of Dove White cardstock with the new Flower Pattern Cover Plate die.

I then adhered some of the flowers and leaves from the diecut to the card front with foam adhesive. I then finished the card with some gold sequins from the Champagne Sequins Mix.

My next card features the gorgeous Color Layering Marbling Stencils and that fantastic Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL once again.

To create this card I first ink-blended over the front of an A2 top-folding Dove White card base with the Color Layering Marbling Stencils. For the first stencil in the set I ink-blended with Pool Party Reactive Ink. For the second stencil I ink-blended with Blue Raspberry Reactive Ink and for the final stencil in the set I applied Gold Hero Paste.

Next, I die cut “friend” out of Mustard and gold glitter cardstock with the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL. I then adhered the two “friend” diecuts together, slightly off-set and then adhered to the card front.

Next, I stamped and gold heat-embossed a sub-sentiment from the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL onto Pitch Black cardstock. Lastly, I trimmed the sub-sentiment down to a strip and then adhered to the card front with foam adhesive.

My next card features the some of the incredible new stamps, stencils and dies from the new Ralph Tyndall and Hero Arts collaborative line!!

To create this card I first ink-blended the stage scene over the front of an A2 top-folding Dove White card base with HA + RT Color Layering Stage Curtain Stencils and Butter Bar, Spicy Mustard, Fawn, Caramel and Cup O’ Joe.

Next, I stamped a sentiment and performers from the HA + RT Center Stage stamp set onto the front of the card base in INTENS-ified Black Ink.

I then die cut the crowd with the HA + RT Center Stage Crowd Fancy Die out of Pitch Black cardstock. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering the crowd to the card front with Precision Glue.

My last card features the beautiful Color Layering Tulip Pattern Stencils

To create this card I first ink-blended over an A2 panel of Passion Flower cardstock with the Color Layering Tulip Pattern Stencils. For the first stencil from the Color Layering Tulip Pattern Stencils I ink-blended with Berry Smoothie Reactive Ink.

I then skipped stencil 2 and moved onto stencil 3 with Kiwi Core Ink and Pine for stencil 4. I then placed stencil 2 over the panel and then applied Pearl Hero Paste that I tinted with Grape Slush.

I then die cut “friend” out of Dove White cardstock with one of the dies from the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL. I then stamped and white heat-embossed a sub-sentiment from the Smile Friend Stamp & Cut XL onto Pitch Black cardstock. Lastly, I trimmed the sentiment down to a strip and then finished the card by adhering the sub-sentiment and “friend” to the card front with foam adhesive.

GIVEAWAY:

Hero Arts will be giving away two $50 gift cards, drawn from the comments left along the hop. Comment on all the blogs for more chances to win! You have until Wednesday, February 21st at 11:59pm to enter. The winners will be announced on the Hero Arts blog.

SPRING 2024 STAMP-ALONG:

Also along with the Spring Catalog Release, the Spring Stamp-Along and the Spring Stamp-Along Bundle is now available to purchase!!!!

Supplies:

Hello all!! It’s release day!!! The February My Monthly Hero Kit is about peace and friendship reminding us that we all share the same sky, the same hopes and dreams. This kit features a 6″ x 8″ clear stamp set filled with beautiful, serene floral images and sentiments that will expand your creative horizons. Also included are a bountiful 17 coordinating dies and 4 tag fancy dies. The kit is rounded out with twine, an ink cube, and a generous amount of white cardstock.

The Premium Kit includes additional elements to extend the potential for more cards and projects – even more Creativity in the Box! In addition to all the Classic Kit components, the highlight of our Premium kit includes a Radiant Sun Stencil and a whopping 48 pieces of ephemera, featuring colorful flowers, hearts, butterflies, and words. Also included is a 3″ x 4″ clear stamp filled with positive messages, word fancy dies, and embossing powder.

I have a couple of cards to share so let’s jump right in! My first card features elements from the Premium kit.

To create this card first ink-blended panel of white cardstock with Lemon Drop, Butter Bar and Spicy Mustard inks. I then placed the Sun Stencil over the panel and then ink-blended with Lemon Drop, Butter Bar, Spicy Mustard, Papaya and Tangerine inks.

I then thoroughly dried the panel and then stamped a sentiment in the center of the panel in Embossing & Watermark Ink from the 3″ x 4″ clear stamp set included in the Premium kit. Next, I poured white embossing powder over and then heat set.

I then stamped the clouds from the clear set in Arctic and Pool Party on white cardstock. I then fussy cut the clouds out. Next, I adhered the blended panel to the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. Lastly, finished the card by adhering the clouds to the card front with foam adhesive.

My next card features the Cosmos and Lavenders stamp set from the February add-ons.

To create this card I first the cosmos and a sentiment from the Cosmos and Lavenders stamp set in Embossing & Watermark ink onto an A2 panel of watercolor paper. I then poured black embossing powder over and then heat set with my heat tool.

Next, I watercolored the images in with liquid watercolors. I then die cut a dove out of watercolor paper with the Dove and the Olive Branch Die.

I then watercolored some details on the dove. Next, I adhered the panel to the front of an A2 top-folding card base. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering the dove to the card front with foam adhesive.

GIVEAWAY:

We will give away a $50 gift card, drawn from the comments left across the hop. Enter by Sunday, February 11th at 11:59pm PT, and the winner will be announced on the Hero Arts blog the following week.

Hello friends!! It’s here!! The January My Monthly Hero Kit is now available and I can’t wait to share with you my creations!! This month’s kits are so so so good and before I share my cards let take a quick look.

CLASSIC KIT:

Kit Contents:

5 Color Layering Floral Background Stencils, 5.25″ x 6.5″

Coordinating Heart Window Frame Cut

Love You Fancy Dies

Love Messages Clear Stamp Set, 4″ x 6″

6 Sheets of Camel Watercolor Paper, 5″ x 7″

3 Core Ink Cubes (Moss, Azalea, Summer Sky)

$70 Value for $36.99

PREMIUM KIT:

Kit Contents:

5 Color Layering Floral Background Stencils, 5.25″ x 6.5″

Coordinating Heart Window Frame Cut

Love You Fancy Dies

10 Floral Fancy Dies

Love Messages Clear Stamp Set, 4″ x 6″

6 Sheets of Camel Watercolor Paper, 5″ x 7″

3 Core Ink Cubes (Moss, Azalea, Summer Sky)

Gold Leaf Flakes

Sparkle Clear Lacquer Pen

Pink Gold Metallic Spray, 1oz.

$106 Value for $49.99

My first card features the 10 Floral Fancy Dies from the Premium My Monthly Hero Kit.

To create this card I first I die cut the flowers and leaves out of various colored cardstocks (Ultra Pink, Coral, Meadow, Pine, Mustard, Papaya, Pumpkin, Cherry, Plum). I then added tape behind the three largest flowers and then inlaid some of the details.

Next, I trimmed the yellow heart flowers away from the stems and then adhered them to a matching green stem and heart flower sprig. I then adhered the flowers and leaves to the front of an A2 top-folding Dove White card base.

I then die cut “love” out of white cardstock with the Love You Fancy Dies. Next, I stamped a sentiment from the Love Messages Clear Stamp Set onto Pitch Black cardstock in Embossing & Watermark Ink. I then poured white embossing powder over and then heat set with my heat tool. Next, I fussy cut the sentiment out and then finished the card by adhering the sentiments to the card front with foam adhesive.

My second card features a few of the add-on products from this release, namely the Flower and Hearts Cover Plate, Love You So Much Cover Plate and the I Love U Stamp & Cut XL.

To create these cards I first die cut an A2 panel of white cardstock with the Flower and Hearts Cover Plate die. I then dry embossed the front of an A2 top-folding card base with the Flower and Hearts Cover Plate die.

Next I copic colored the dry embossed images and then adhered the Flower and Hearts panel on top. I then die cut a sentiment out of white cardstock with the dies from the I Love U Stamp & Cut XL and then adhered them to card front with foam adhesive. Lastly I finished the card by adhering one of the hearts from the Flower and Hearts Cover Plate to the sentiment.

For the second card I copic colored some of the flowers left over from the Flower and Heart panel. I then adhered the flowers to the front of an A2 top-folding white card base with foam adhesive. Next, I die cut some white cardstock with the Love You So Much Cover Plate to create a sentiment. I then fussy cut the “love” away from the rest of the panel and then finished the card by adhering the sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.

Giveaway:

Hero Arts will be giving away a $50 gift card, drawn from the comments left across the hop. Enter by Sunday, January 14th at 11:59pm PT, and the winner will be announced on the Hero Arts blog the following week.

Hello all!! It’s release day!! The December 2023 My Monthly Hero Release is now available!! You just got to love an Alphabet release!! There’s almost nothing more versatile than a clean and graphic Alphabet stamp and die set and this release has both and much much more! Before I share my cards let’s take a look at the Classic and Premium kits.

Classic Kit:

Contents:

XL Alphabet Clear Stamp Set, 8″ x 10″

Alphabet Cover Plate Die

10 Pack of Watercolor Pencils

6 Sheets of Luxe White Watercolor Paper, 8.5″ x 11″

Water Flow Brush

Classic Kit: $81 Value for $36.99

Premium Kit:

Contents:

XL Alphabet Clear Stamp Set, 8″ x 10″

Numbers Clear Stamp Set, 4″ x 6″

Alphabet Cover Plate Die

10 Pack of Watercolor Pencils

6 Sheets of Luxe White Watercolor Paper, 8.5″ x 11″

Water Flow Brush

Fineline Applicator

Sea Salt Reactive Ink Reinker

Gold Glimmer Metallic Ink

Premium Kit: $112 Value for $49.99

My first card features stamps and dies from the Classic December My Monthly Hero Kit.

To create this card I first stamped several images from the XL Alphabet Stamp Set in INTENS-ified Black Ink onto an A2 panel of Dove White cardstock.

I then copic colored the images in and then trimmed the panel down to 4″ x 5 1/4″. Next, I die cut an A2 panel of Pitch Black cardstock with the Alphabet Cover Plate.

I then adhered the letters onto the panel with foam adhesive. I then finished the card by adhering the panel onto an A2 top-folding Dove White card base.

My second card features some of the amazing add-ons from this release, namely the Letter Fancy Dies and the Decorative Accents Fancy Dies.

To create this card I first die cut the letters “H”, “E” and “Y” with dies from the Letter E-I and W-Z Fancy Dies out of Dove White cardstock. I then ink blended over the letters with Reactive Inks. I used Taffy and Fruit Punch for the “H”, Creamsicle and Lemon Drop for the “E” and Key Lime Fizz and Pool Party for the “Y”.

Once I finished ink-blended the letters I then die cut some flourishes with the Decorative Accents Fancy Dies out of Dove White cardstock. I then adhered the letters and flourishes to the an A2 top-folding Dove White card base with foam adhesive.

Next, I stamped an additional sentiment from the Messages Basics Stamp Set onto Pitch Black cardstock in Embossing & Watermark Ink. I then poured white embossing powder over, heat set and then trimmed down to a strip. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering the sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.

Giveaway:

Hero Arts will give away a $50 gift card, drawn from the comments left across the hop. Enter by Sunday, December 10th at 11:59pm Pacific, and the winner will be announced on the Hero Arts blog the following week.

Supplies:

Hello crafty friends!! The November Pinkfresh Studio release is now available!! This release is full of so many beautiful new stamp, dies and stencils. There’s a couple new holiday themed sets, some new florals and even a new alphabet set!!

The card I created features the Holiday Spirit stamp and die set.

To create this card I first stamped and gold heat-embossed the glass, ornament and orange slice onto white cardstock. Then with the coordinating stencils I ink-blended over the images to add color. I used Marigold, Apricot and Bay Leaf for the drink; Passion Fruit and Berrylicious for the berries and swizzle stick; Doe and Gathered Twigs for the star of anise; Olive and Spruce Tips for the rosemary sprig; and Apricot, Clementine and Fruit Punch for the orange.

After I ink blended all the images I then added a bit to the images with a little copic coloring on the ornament, sizzle stick, berries and orange rind. Next, I ink blended the design to the glass in Calico White. Next, I die cut the images out with the coordinating dies.

I then repeated this process to create a second drink and orange. I then ink-blended the upper right and lower left corners of an A2 panel of dark green cardstock with Lush Forest. Next, I adhered the panel onto the from of an A2 top-folding white card base. I then stamped and gold heat embossed a sentiment from the set onto dark green cardstock. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering the images and sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.

Giveaway:

Pinkfresh will be giving away the full release on the Pinkfresh blog & YouTube channel.

Pinkfresh will also be giving away a total of TEN $25 gift cards along the hop. As per usual with blog hops – the winners will be picked from the comments.

Winners will be posted on November 21, 2023 on the Pinkfresh Studio GIVEAWAY PAGE. Winners must claim their prize within 2 weeks.

Blog Hop:

You are invited to the Inlinkz link party!

Click here to enter

https://fresh.inlinkz.com/js/widget/load.js?id=c0efdbe6b4add43dd7ef

I hope you enjoyed my card. Thank you so much for stopping by!

~Channin

Hello friends!! It’s here!! The November 2023 My Monthly Hero Release is now available!! With this month’s focus on mail art this release is very fun and unique. I have to admit that I rarely if ever consider the envelope when cardmaking but I have loved thinking outside the card with this month’s kits and creating matching envelopes to all my cards!

That being said I have two cards with two matching envelopes to share today but before we dive into the projects let’s take a look at the kits.

Classic Kit:

Classic Kit Contents:

Mail Art Clear Stamp Set, 6″ x 8″

28 Coordinating Dies

2 Postage Stamp Frame Francy Dies

1 Sheet of Message Hero Transfers, 6′ x 8′

27 Assorted Envelopes in Red, Kraft and White (A1, A2, A7 sizes)

10 Sheets of Blank Washi Sticker Paper, 6″ x 6″

4 Wax Seal Stickers

Classic Kit: $73 Value for $36.99

Premium Kit:

Premium Kit Contents:

Mail Art Clear Stamp Set, 6″ x 8″

Peeking Critters Clear Stamp Set, 3″ x 4″

28 Coordinating Dies

2 Postage Stamp Frame Fancy Dies

2 Color Layering Snowflake Stencils, 5.25″ x 6.5″

1 Sheet of Message Hero Transfers, 6″ x 8″

2 Sheet of Gift Hero Transfers, 6″ x 8″

2 Ink Cubes (Pool Party Reactive Ink, Mist core Ink)

27 Assorted Envelopes in Red, Kraft and White (A1, A2, A7 sizes)

10 Sheets of Blank Washi Sticker Paper, 6″ x 8″

4 Wax Seal Stickers

Premium Kit: $103 Value for $49.99

My first card features the 2 Color Layering Snowflake Stencils from the Premium kit and the Mail Art Clear Stamp Set from both kitsl

To create this card I first ink-blended the base layer for the 2 Color Layering Snowflake Stencils in Arctic, Pool Party, Blue Raspberry and Aquatic inks over the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. I then removed the stencil and lightly ink-blended over the snowflakes with the same inks. Next, I positioned the detail layer from the 2 Color Layering Snowflake Stencils and applied Gold Hero Paste over and then removed the stencil and set the card base aside to dry.

I then stamped and gold heat-embossed some snowflakes and a sentiment from the Mail Art Clear Stamp Set onto white cardstock. Next, I die cut the sentiment and the images out with the matching dies and then adhered them to the card front with foam adhesive.

Next, I added gold accents with the Gold Hero Pearls to complete the card. To make the envelope I simply applied some Gold Hero Paste over the detail layer stencil from the 2 Color Layering Snowflake Stencils.

My next card features the Holiday Flourishes Stencils and Stamp Set as well as the the Winter Town Cheer Stamp Set.

To create this card I first stamped the largest floral image from the Holiday Flourishes stamp in INTENS-ified Black Ink onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. I stamped the large image twice to create a focal point for the card.

Once I finished stamping I then colored the flourishes in with copic markers. I then used one of the stencils from the Color Layering Holiday Flourishes Stencils and ink-blended with Arctic Core Ink to add some color to the branches and stems.

I then stamped and gold heat-embossed a sentiment from the Winter Town Cheer stamp set onto Pitch Black cardstock. Next, I fussy cut the sentiment out and then adhered it to the card front with foam adhesive. Lastly I finished the card by adding Hero Gold Hero Pearls.

To create the matching envelope I simply stamped a red envelope with the large flourish image in Cranberry Core Ink.

Giveaway:

Hero Arts will give away a $50 gift card, drawn from the comments left across the hop. Enter by Sunday, November 12th at 11:59pm Pacific, and the winner will be announced on the Hero Arts blog the following week.

Supplies:

Hello crafty friends! It’s release day at Waffle Flower Crafts!! Welcome to the Waffle Flower November Release Blog Hop! I’m happy to be hopping with the folks from Waffle Flower to show you all the fun new stuff awaiting you on the Waffle Flower website! Be sure to check out each stop in today’s blog hop for fun, inspiration, and chances to win some of these new release goodies!

I have several cards to share so lets jump right on in! My first card features the Paws Up Die and the Purrfect Sentiments Stamp Set.

To create this card I first die cut colored cardstock with the Paws Up Die Set. After I die cut the parts for the paws I then adhered them together. For the arm of one the cats I hand cut some ambiguous shapes from an arms diecut to create marbled fur.

Once I finished adhering all my cat arms together I then trimmed down a sheet of pattern paper from the Unicorn Half-Half Dots paper pad to an A2 panel. I then adhered the panel onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base.

Next, I stamped a sentiment from the Purrfect Sentiments Stamp Set onto the card front in black ink. Lastly I finished the card by adhering the paws with foam adhesive.

My next card features the Simple Shelves Die and Stencil Duo as well as the Shelf Add-on Dies.

To create this card I first ink-blended an A2 panel of cream cardstock with the Simple Shelves Stencil Duo and several Distress Inks (Cracked Pistachio, Crackling Campfire, Worn Lipstick, Scattered Straw, Wild Honey, Pine Needles and Uncharted Mariner).

Once I finished ink-blending the images for the shelves I then stamped a sentiment from the Simple Book Sentiments Stamp Set in Iced Spruce Distress Oxide. I then adhered the panel onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base.

Next, I die cut the shelves out of white cardstock with the Simple Shelves Die. I then adhered the shelves to the card front with foam adhesive. Next, I die cut several accents for the shelves with the Shelf Add-on Dies out of white cardstock. I then ink-blended the diecuts with the same Distress Inks I used to create the background. Once I finished ink-blending the diecuts, I then adhered them to the card front with foam adhesive.

My next card features the Simple Books Stencils and the Simple Shelves Die and the Simple Book Sentiments Stamp Set again.

To create this card I first used the left overs or negatives from the previous card when I created the Simple Shelves diecut. I then ink-blended over the negatives with the Simple Books Stencils and several Distress Inks (Mustard Seed, Wild Honey, Picked Raspberry, Barn Door, Mermaid Lagoon, Broken China, Mowed Lawn and Rustic Wilderness).

Once I finished ink-blending the books I then stamped and gold heat embossed a few sentiments from the Simple Book Sentiments Stamp Set onto several of the book spines. I then trimmed down a piece of pattern paper from the Botanical Half-Half Lines paper pad to an A2 panel. I then adhered the panel onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base.

Next, I stamped some Kraft cardstock with the Wood Grain Stamp Set in Walnut Stain Distress Oxide. I then trimmed the Kraft cardstock down to 3/4″ x 5 1/2″ and adhered to the card front. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering the books to the card front with foam adhesive.

My next card features the Cat Tree House, the Cattitude Die and the Subsentiments Cat Diecuts.

To create this card I first cut the cat tree out of cream and tan cardstocks. I then fussy cut some of the platforms and beds out of the tan cardstock and adhered them to the cream cat tree base.

Next, I die cut several of the cats out of white, black, grey, rust and brown cardstocks with the Cattitude Dies. I then copic colored some of the cat die cuts to make different fur patterns and colors. Next, I with a copic Multiliner I added faces to all the cats except for the black cat which I used a white gel pen instead. I then adhered the cats to my cat tree.

Next, I die cut the ramps, the second layer for the cat beds and the opening for the cat house out of light Kraft cardstock. I then adhered the ramps and beds to the cat tree. Next, I trimmed down a piece of pattern paper from the Enchanted Half-Half Lines Paper Pad to 4 1/4″ x 5 1/2″. I then adhered the panel to the front of an A2 top-folding white card base.

Next, I adhered the cat tree to the card front with foam adhesive. Then I adhered the opening to the cat bed to the card front as well. Lastly, I finished the card by adhering a sentiment from the Subsentiments Cat Diecut.

My last card features the Pop-up Books Panel Die and the Two-Tone Books Stencil.

To create this card I first die cut the front of an A2 top-folding white card base with the Pop-up Books Panel Die. I then ink blended over the panel with the Two-Tone Books Stencil and several Distress Inks (Crackling Campfire, Walnut Stain, Mowed Lawn, Wild Honey, Tumbled Glass and Spun Sugar).

After, I ink-blending the books I then die cut an A2 panel of dark green cardstock with the Pop-up Books Panel Die. I then fussy cut the books out and then adhered the panel over the card front. Next, I die cut “thank you” with the Print & Script Thank You Dies out of vellum and gold cardstock. I then adhered the two layers together and then adhered the sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.

Lastly, I finished the card by stamping and gold heat embossing a sentiment from the Story Sentiments Stamp Set onto black cardstock, fussy cut it out and then adhered it to the card front with foam adhesive.

Giveaways:

For today’s hop, we are giving away $25 gift certificate to THREE lucky winners! You can leave a comment on this blog and along the hop by 11:59pm EST on Saturday November 11th, 2023 for your chances to win. Winners will be chosen at random from the comments and will be announced on the Waffle Flower Blog on Winner Monday 11/13/2023.

Supplies:

Hello crafty friends!! Today I’m joining Simon Says Stamp in celebrating their All the Joy Release!! Be sure to check out the All the Joy release gallery to see all the inspiration from this release in one place!

Let’s dive right in a take a look at the card I created for today’s blog hop. This card features the beautiful Burst Snowflakes Embossing Folder & Die as well as the All the Joy Die and Christmas Greetings Sentiment Strips.

To create this card I first ink-blended an 4 1/8″ x 5 3/8″ panel of white cardstock in Chipped Sapphire, Prize Ribbon, Mermaid Lagoon and Salvaged Patina Distress Oxides. I then dry embossed the panel with the Burst Snowflakes Embossing Folder. Next, I lightly sanded the raised areas of the panel and then rubbed Hero Arts Gold Wax over. I then adhered the panel to the front of an A2 top-folding white card base.

Next, die cut the All the Joy Die out of gold and white cardstocks. I then adhered the layers together and then adhered to the card front with foam adhesive.

Lastly, I finished the card by adhering a sentiment strip from the Christmas Greetings Sentiment Strips under the die cut sentiment with foam adhesive.

My second card features the Autumn Frame Stencils, Not Quite a Dot Cling Stamp and the All the Joy Die.

To create this card I first stamped a tan 4 1/8″ x 5 3/8″ panel with the Not Quite a Dot Cling Stamp in Old Paper to create subtle background. I then ink-blended over the panel with the Autumn Frame Stencils and several Distress Oxides (Worn Lipstick, Festive Berries, Fossilized Amber, Dried Marigold, Peeled Paint, Mowed Lawn and Ground Espresso).

Once I finished ink-blending the leaves I then adhered the panel onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. I then added a white highlight to all the images with a gel pen. Next, I added a drop shadow to images with a copic marker.

I then die the All the Joy sentiment out of white and brown cardstock and then adhered the layers together. Lastly I finished the card by adhering the sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.
